results.title: The Rough road to freedom
results.creator_credit: James Beveridge and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Crossroads of the world: a study of North Africa and the Middle East”.
Describes the western influence in North Africa and the Middle East. Technology which had halted for a thousand years, spurts ahead as new revolutionary leaders, like Bourguiba, Nasser and Kassem, reogranise feudal society and restore the pride of the people and the fertility of their soil. In the drylands of the United Arab Republic you climb great engineering works which irrigate the fields, power the machinery and give light to schools and colleges where a new generation of Egyptians prepare for modern life.

results.title: The Invisible World
results.creator_credit: Alex Pomasanoff and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description: If it were not for some extraordinary photographic techniques, sophisticated cameras and imaging devices, many events that the human eye cannot perceive - because these occurrences are too small, too large, too fast or beyond the spectrum of visible light - would go unnoticed. This film captures such events that would otherwise escape our inspection.

results.title: Sun, sand and sea
results.creator_credit: James Beveridge and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Crossroads of the world: a study of North Africa and the Middle East”
This film sets the scene for the series, reviewing the cultural background of the North Africa-Middle East region as well as its geography. Ity traces the origins of the Islamic peoples, discusses Mahomet and his teachings, and shows the extent of the Arab conquest and its contribution to our arts, science and technology. The film closes with the decline of Islam, its retreat and isolation from the world through many centuries.

results.title: NBA Showtime: NBA on NBC for Game Boy Color
results.material_description: Cartridge videogame. Cartridge, manual, registration card, consumer information booklet and Nintendo Power advert in cardboard box
results.brief_description:
A 2D adaptation of the 3D console game, this port maintains the fast, action-packed and unrealistic two on two style of basketball from the original. The switch to 2D actually harkens back to the series’ roots, which began in the same style before switching to 3D.

The game includes all 29 teams of the 1999-2000 NBA season, with over 100 featured players. Modes include exhibition games, full season, playoffs and a practice mode.

results.title: The Contest for power
results.creator_credit: James Beveridge and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Crossroads of the world: a study of North Africa and the Middle East”.
Change is neither easy nor even. In this film you see neighboring countries in North Africa and the Middle East with vastly different forms of government. In monarchies, all power resides in a king; in others, military juntas rule. Here and there democratic governments hold power. Everywhere, from Iraq to Algeria, the ferment of change shows in many ways. Part four of the original six-part series.
results.creator_credit_for_label: James Beveridge and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Invisible children (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Christopher Brough, Rift Fournier and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Presents the Kids on the Block, a unique group of puppets in that one is deaf, one blind and another in a wheelchair. They tour the country encouraging non-disabled children to ask and learn about their handicapped peers and to see the world through different eyes. Stars Gary Burghoff (from TV’s MASH) and was made during an actual classroom presentation. Suitable for middle and upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: The Impossible takes a little longer
results.creator_credit: Anne Henderson, Barbara Janes, Kathleen Shannon and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The Impossible Takes a Little Longer documents the work and personal lives of five physically disabled women. It shows how they are coping with the problems they share with all women, the problems they share with other disabled women and those unique to their particular circumstances. The film affirms that disabled women can lead full and productive lives as workers, as mothers and as valued community members. It informs both disabled women and the able-bodied about the possibilities of adaptations in the workplace, the use of technological aids and the need for support systems if disabled women are to have satisfying and productive lives. The Impossible Takes a Little Longer undermines the stereotypes and prejudices that further hinder a large segment of our population.
